column4: I kinda need some help here. I've tried to install Ubuntu on a IBM Aptiva. But the damn thing won't reboot properly.
Describe "not properly"
Anything before "boot"?
Anything after it, like a colon?
The two last lines it displays is:
Has it ever booted into Ubuntu, or are you currently installing?
Did you get any error message (red screen)?
Nope. It just stops not bothering to do anyting more...
Did it announce it'd reboot?
That it did. It announced, it boots kinda ("Booting Ubuntu, kernel 2.6.8.1-3-386") and stops...
What is the CPU in the machine?
Bramd?
Intel.
Then I have no idea what could be wrong. You can try doing a manual installation, choosing for lilo instead of grub, to see if that makes any difference.
So it should work? Well... I'm really not too good at installing manual... give me some hints?
Just go with the defaults, and where you get the chance to choose grub, refuse that. The next option will be LILO.
I'll try that. See you in a bit then! :)
It's been a while since I did this, so I'm not sure where exactly in the installer this is.
The install went ok, but the boot failed again. Lilo only says that bios memory ok, and stops...
That's not something LILO normally says :)
I'm sorry, but I have no idea what's wrong with your system.
